[PARAGRAPH:2]Der Pazifismus ist vor allem in schwachen oder unterdrückten Ländern weit verbreitet. Gewinnt eine Gesellschaft aber an Einfluss, weicht der Pazifismus nicht selten militanteren Konzepten.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il pacifismo è il credo religioso secondo il quale tutti i conflitti sono contrari al volere di Dio. Gli uomini non devono combattere tra loro; se una persona ti dà uno schiaffo, porgi l'altra guancia. Fondamentalmente, ciò che accade a una persona in questo mondo non conta molto: se si viene derubati o uccisi e non si reagisce, si conquisterà il Paradiso (magari nella successiva incarnazione). Il ladro o l'assassino potranno godersi i risultati del loro operato in questa vita, ma soffriranno dieci volte tanto in quella successiva. [PARAGRAPH:2]Il pacifismo gode di molta popolarità nelle nazioni deboli, i cui abitanti non potrebbero opporsi fisicamente agli oppressori. Quando queste persone conquistano il potere e il controllo sui propri destini, tuttavia, spesso abbandonano il pacifismo in cambio di un credo più battagliero.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El pacifismo es la creencia religiosa en que todo conflicto contradice la voluntad de Dios. El hombre no debe luchar contra el hombre. Si alguien te abofetea, ofrécele la otra mejilla. Básicamente, lo que le ocurre en el mundo real a la persona que lo practica no tiene demasiada importancia: si alguien te roba o te asesina sin que te defiendas, recibirás tu recompensa en el cielo (o en tu próxima encarnación). El otro puede disfrutar de lo robado durante unos pocos años, pero al final acabará pagándolo con creces en la otra vida. [PARAGRAPH:2]El pacifismo goza de gran predicamento entre aquellos pueblos o naciones que no poseen mucho poder y que son incapaces de ofrecer resistencia a sus opresores. Sin embargo, en cuanto su poder aumenta y obtienen algún control sobre su destino, suelen renunciar al pacifismo para abrazar creencias más belicosas.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Free religion refers to a society in which no single religion is dominant, in which people are free to worship or not worship as they please. There is no state religion; the government is totally secular. [PARAGRAPH:2]Such states allow all to express their religious beliefs. This encourages immigration by people whose religions are suppressed elsewhere, and the general society benefits from the multitude of experiences and beliefs of its members. However, such freedom and tolerance of religions may weaken a nation's people's beliefs in any religion, which could cause the people to become morally lax and decadent. Further, members of the more militant and expansionist religions may seek to destroy the competition, causing a good deal of stress and conflict within a country. A good deal of maturity is required on the part of a government and its people to successfully sustain free religion.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La liberté de culte fait référence à une société dans laquelle il n'y a pas de religion dominante, et qui laisse ses citoyens libres de croire ou de ne pas croire. Il n'y a pas de religion d'Etat. Le gouvernement est totalement laïc. [PARAGRAPH:2]De tels Etats permettent que l'on exprime ses croyances religieuses. Ceci encourage l'immigration de populations dont la religion est ailleurs réprimée, et toute la société bénéficie de la diversité des cultures de sa population. Cependant, une telle liberté et tolérance religieuse risque d'affaiblir le sentiment religieux de toute la nation. Ceci peut provoquer un relâchement de la morale. De même, les croyants des religions les plus militantes peuvent essayer d'en profiter pour assurer leur domination, provoquant alors des conflits à l'intérieur du pays. Pour réussir, la liberté de culte demande donc une grande maturité de la part du gouvernement et du peuple.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Herrscht in einer Gesellschaft Religionsfreiheit, darf jeder Bürger und Besucher des Landes seine Religion ungestört ausüben. Es gibt keine Staatsreligion und eine strenge Trennung von Kirche und Staat. [PARAGRAPH:2]Da in Ländern mit Religionsfreiheit das Recht der freien Religionsausübung gilt, ist die Zuwanderungsrate von Menschen, die in ihrer Heimat aufgrund ihres Glaubens verfolgt werden, sehr hoch. In der Regel profitiert die Gesellschaft von der religiösen Vielschichtigkeit ihrer Mitglieder. Allerdings können Religionsfreiheit und Toleranz im Extremfall auch zum Niedergang des Glaubens führen. Darüber hinaus wird die Religionsfreiheit immer wieder von militanten Gruppierungen missbraucht. Die Erhaltung der Religionsfreiheit in offenen Gesellschaften ist daher eine der größten Herausforderungen der Zukunft.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]La libertà religiosa si ha nelle nazioni in cui non esiste una singola religione dominante e le persone sono libere di fare ciò che vogliono. Non esiste una religione di stato: il governo è assolutamente laico. [PARAGRAPH:2]In questi stati è permesso esprimere i propri credo religiosi: in tal modo, si incoraggia l'immigrazione di persone di una religione che è stata magari vietata nella nazione di origine; la società migliora con le esperienze e le fedi di ogni individuo. Malgrado ciò, questo tipo di libertà e tolleranza verso le altre religioni potrebbe indebolire la fede della popolazione, facendo crollare il morale. Inoltre, i membri delle religioni più battagliere ed espansioniste potrebbero tentare di eliminare i "rivali", provocando tensioni e conflitti all'interno del paese. Perché sia possibile la libertà di religione, ci vuole buon senso da parte del governo e della popolazione.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La libertad religiosa caracteriza a aquellas sociedades en las que no existe una única religión dominante y la gente tiene derecho a profesar la religión que desee. No existe religión oficial; el gobierno es totalmente secular. [PARAGRAPH:2]Estos estados permiten que todos expresen sus creencias religiosas. Esto atrae la inmigración de las minorías religiosas perseguidas en otras partes del mundo, y la sociedad en su conjunto se beneficia de la multitud de experiencias y creencias de sus miembros. Sin embargo, la libertad y tolerancia religiosas pueden debilitar el espíritu religioso de la nación, lo que puede desembocar en una población carente de principios morales y decadente. Además, los seguidores de las religiones más militantes y proselitistas pueden tratar de destruir a sus competidores, atizando el fuego del descontento y el desorden civil. Para que exista auténtica libertad religiosa, la sociedad y el gobierno deben hacer gala de una notable madurez.

TEXT.English: [TAB]An inquisitorial system is a legal system where the court or a part of the court is actively involved in determining the facts of the case, as opposed to an adversarial system where the role of the court is solely that of an impartial referee between parties. Inquisitorial systems are used in most countries in Europe and Latin America. [PARAGRAPH:2]Until the Medieval inquisition in the 12th century, the legal systems used in medieval Europe generally relied on the adversarial system to determine whether someone should be tried and whether that person is guilty or innocent. Under this system, unless a person was caught in the act of committing a crime, they could not be tried for a crime until they had been formally accused, either by the voluntary accusations of a sufficient number of witnesses or by an inquest (an early form of grand jury) convened specifically for that purpose. A weakness of this system was that because it relied on the voluntary accusations of witnesses, and because the penalties for making a false accusation were severe, would-be witnesses could be hesitant to actually make their accusations to the court, for fear of implicating themselves. Because of the difficulties in deciding cases, procedures such as ordeal or combat were accepted, though it is generally agreed nowadays that these procedures are not acceptable ways of finding truth or settling a dispute. [PARAGRAPH:2]Beginning in 1198, Pope Innocent III issued a series of decretals that reformed the ecclesiastical court system. Under the new processus per inquisitionem (inquisitional procedure) an ecclesiastical magistrate no longer required a formal accusation to summon and try a defendant. Instead, an ecclesiastical court could summon and interrogate witnesses of its own initiative, and if the (possibly secret) testimony of those witnesses accused a person of a crime, that person could then be summoned and tried. In 1215, the Fourth Council of the Lateran affirmed the use of the inquisitional system. The council also forbade clergy from conducting trials by ordeal or combat. As a result, in parts of continental Europe, the ecclesiastical courts operating under the inquisitional procedure became the dominant method by which disputes were adjudicated. In France, the parlements  lay courts  employed inquisitorial proceedings. [PARAGRAPH:2]In the development of modern legal institutions which occurred in the 19th century, for the most part, most jurisdictions did not only codify their private law and criminal law, but the rules of civil procedure were reviewed and codified as well. It was through this movement that the role of an inquisitorial system became enshrined in most European civilian legal systems. However, there exist significant differences of operating methods and procedures between 18th century ancien regime courts and 19th century courts; in particular, limits on the powers of investigators were typically added, as well as increased rights of the defense.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The rising technology has allowed our environment to be characterized as a global one. "The global economy" gave business the ability to market products and services all over the globe. It has also allowed them to develop partnerships and alliances throughout the world, which has become essential for success in todays business. Prior to Globalization, the United States dominated the global economy. In past decades, however, the U.S. share of the global economy has shrunk to approximately 20% (from almost 50% in 1945). This trend is expected to continue as the economies of many newly industrialized countries continue to grow at a faster rate, this is called the balancing of the equilibrium. [PARAGRAPH:2]There are numerous advantages in the shift to a global economy including the possibility to increase benefits from economies of scale. The breaking down of global barriers allows companies to benefit from the largest and cheapest workforces, raw materials, and technology. For example, "many North American publishers actually write and produce much of their software in countries such as India." Other advantages that companies benefit from include: the opportunity for smaller companies to quickly expand globally, having more choices when recruiting a workforce and the opportunity to target a larger customer base (which translates to greater earning potential).

TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]The rising technology has allowed our environment to be characterized as a global one. "The global economy" gave business the ability to market products and services all over the globe. It has also allowed them to develop partnerships and alliances throughout the world, which has become essential for success in todays business. Prior to Globalization, the United States dominated the global economy. In past decades, however, the U.S. share of the global economy has shrunk to approximately 20% (from almost 50% in 1945). This trend is expected to continue as the economies of many newly industrialized countries continue to grow at a faster rate, this is called the balancing of the equilibrium. [PARAGRAPH:2]There are numerous advantages in the shift to a global economy including the possibility to increase benefits from economies of scale. The breaking down of global barriers allows companies to benefit from the largest and cheapest workforces, raw materials, and technology. For example, "many North American publishers actually write and produce much of their software in countries such as India." Other advantages that companies benefit from include: the opportunity for smaller companies to quickly expand globally, having more choices when recruiting a workforce and the opportunity to target a larger customer base (which translates to greater earning potential).

TEXT.English: [TAB]Apprenticeship is a system of training a new generation of skilled crafts practitioners. Apprentices (or in early modern usage "prentices") build their careers from apprenticeships. Most of their training is done on the job while working for an employer who helps the apprentices learn their trade. An informal, theoretical education may also be involved. [PARAGRAPH:2]The system of apprenticeship first developed in the later Middle Ages and came to be supervised by craft guilds and town governments. A master craftsman was entitled to employ young people as an inexpensive form of labour in exchange for providing formal training in the craft. Most apprentices were males, but female apprentices were found in a number of crafts associated with embroidery, silk-weaving etc. Apprentices were young (usually about fourteen to twenty-one years of age), unmarried and would live in the master craftsman's household. Most apprentices aspired to becoming master craftsmen themselves on completion of their contract (usually a term of seven years), but some would spend time as a journeyman and a significant proportion would never acquire their own workshop.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Herbalism is a traditional medicinal or folk medicine practice based on the use of plants and plant extracts. Herbalism is also known as botanical medicine, medicinal botany, medical herbalism, herbal medicine, herbology, and phytotherapy. Sometimes the scope of herbal medicine is extended to include fungi and bee products, as well as minerals, shells and certain animal parts. [PARAGRAPH:2]Many plants synthesize substances that are useful to the maintenance of health in humans and other animals. These include aromatic substances, most of which are phenols or their oxygen-substituted derivatives such as tannins. Many are secondary metabolites, of which at least 12,000 have been isolated  a number estimated to be less than 10% of the total. In many cases, these substances (particularly the alkaloids) serve as plant defense mechanisms against predation by microorganisms, insects, and herbivores. Many of the herbs and spices used by humans to season food yield useful medicinal compounds. [PARAGRAPH:2]In the written record, the study of herbs dates back over 5,000 years to the Sumerians, who described well-established medicinal uses for such plants as laurel, caraway, and thyme. The first known Chinese herb book (or herbal), dating from about 2700 B.C., lists 365 medicinal plants and their uses - including ma-Huang, the shrub that introduced the drug ephedrine to modern medicine. The Egyptians of 1000 B.C. are known to have used garlic, opium, castor oil, coriander, mint, indigo, and other herbs for medicine and the Old Testament also mentions herb use and cultivation, including mandrake, vetch, caraway, wheat, barley, and rye.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Heritage refers to education where tradition, customs and practices are inherited from ancestors. [PARAGRAPH:2]A tradition is a practice, custom, or story that is memorized and passed down from generation to generation, originally without the need for a writing system. Tools to aid this process include poetic devices such as rhyme and alliteration. The stories thus preserved are also referred to as tradition, or as part of an oral tradition.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Ignorance 1) is a lack of knowledge. Ignorance is also a "state of being ignorant" or unaware/uninformed. Ex: "In debate class Bill lost the debate because he was ignorant in (without knowledge of) that subject." In such a case the term is not pejorative, and may even be used as a selfdescriptive term, as in "I am ignorant of (some subect or topic)". Ignorance can also be more than a lack of knowledge. It can include a deliberate intent to ignore knowledge or facts that conflict with what someone believes or wants to be true. [PARAGRAPH:2](pejorative definition) Ignorance 2) is the choice to not act or behave in accordance with regard to certain information in order to suit ones own needs/beliefs."I know better but I choose to ignore that and do/say/act in a way that behooves me." In a society with a strong hierarchy or caste system, ignorance of the concerns of those one does not work or deal with directly may aid labour specialization, reduce jealousy and dissent, and otherwise serve the interests of social harmony. In such a society, any mass media tends to be carefully controlled, and inquiry into forbidden knowledge tends to be punished severely.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Military education and training is a process which intends to establish and improve the capabilities of military personnel in their respective roles. [PARAGRAPH:2]Military education can be voluntary or compulsory duty. Before any person get authorization to operate technical equipment or be on the battle field, he or she has to take a medical and often a physical test. If passed, he or she may begin primary training. [PARAGRAPH:2]The primary training is recruit training. Recruit training attempts to teach the basic information and training in techniques necessary to be an effective servicemember. To achieve this, servicemembers are drilled physically, technically and psychologically. The drill instructor has the task of making the servicemembers fit for military use. [PARAGRAPH:2]After finishing basic training, many servicemembers undergo advanced training more in line with their chosen or assigned specialties. This range from navy training to studies of explosives. In advanced training, military technology and equipment is often taught. [PARAGRAPH:2]Many large countries have several military academies, one for each branch of the service, that offer college degrees in a variety of subjects, similar to other colleges. However, academy graduates usually rank as officers, and as such have many options besides civilian work in their major subject. Higher ranking officers also have further educational opportunities.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Additional treatment at hospitals and clinics are offered to wealthier people of the nation, their additional investment serves the health of the whole population because they don't occupy waiting lists for standard patients.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Private schools, or independent schools, are schools not administered by local, state, or national government, which retain the right to select their student body and are funded in whole or in part by charging their students tuition rather than with public (state) funds. In the United Kingdom and some other Commonwealth countries the use of the term is generally restricted to primary and secondary educational levels: it is almost never used of universities or other tertiary institutions.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The term public school has different (and in some cases contradictory) meanings due to regional differences. In most of the world, it refers to a government-funded primary or secondary school; in some countries, it can refer to government-funded higher education; in England, Wales and Northern Ireland it refers to certain elite, private primary and secondary schools. [PARAGRAPH:2]In many English-speaking nations (but only in Scotland within the United Kingdom), a public school is a school that is financed and run by the government and does not charge tuition fees in order for children to attend. This is in contrast to a private school (also known as an "independent school"). Here, the word "public" is used in the sense of "public library", i.e. provided to the public at public expense. These public schools range in classes from kindergarten to four years of high school or secondary school, normally lasting until one is 17/18 years of age. [PARAGRAPH:2]There are variations on the name, such as "state school", which is used in the UK and some other countries. In Hong Kong they are called "government schools".
TEXT.French: [TAB]The term public school has different (and in some cases contradictory) meanings due to regional differences. In most of the world, it refers to a government-funded primary or secondary school; in some countries, it can refer to government-funded higher education; in England, Wales and Northern Ireland it refers to certain elite, private primary and secondary schools. [PARAGRAPH:2]In many English-speaking nations (but only in Scotland within the United Kingdom), a public school is a school that is financed and run by the government and does not charge tuition fees in order for children to attend. This is in contrast to a private school (also known as an "independent school"). Here, the word "public" is used in the sense of "public library", i.e. provided to the public at public expense. These public schools range in classes from kindergarten to four years of high school or secondary school, normally lasting until one is 17/18 years of age. [PARAGRAPH:2]There are variations on the name, such as "state school", which is used in the UK and some other countries. In Hong Kong they are called "government schools".

TEXT.English: [TAB]Healthcare is controlled by the government. A special commity overlooks the Pharmaceutical industry as well as Doctors, Hospitals, and other aspects of treatment of the population.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Shamanism refers to a range of traditional beliefs and practices concerned with communication with the spirit world. Shamans have the ability to diagnose and cure human suffering and, in some societies, the ability to cause suffering. This is believed to be accomplished by traversing the axis mundi and forming a special relationship with, or gaining control over, spirits. Shamans have been credited with the ability to control the weather, divination, the interpretation of dreams, astral projection, and traveling to upper and lower worlds. Shamanistic traditions have existed throughout the world since prehistoric times. [PARAGRAPH:2]Shamanism is based on the premise that the visible world is pervaded by invisible forces or spirits that affect the lives of the living. In contrast to animism and animatism, which any and usually all members of a society practice, shamanism requires specialized knowledge or abilities. It could be said that shamans are the experts employed by animists and animist communities. Shamans are often organized into full-time ritual or spiritual associations, like priests. In Indian culture as well there are those who are called tantrics and are said to have the power to control spirits and force them to do their bidding. People often visit them for many reasons but most often it is to ensure the spirit's aid in their work or to curse someone who they feel is an enemy of theirs or opposes them.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Subsidized represents the government putting in place a progressive income tax where the rich pay higher taxes and the revenue is used to subsidize low income housing, food stamps, ETC. Also included is free public education for elementary, junior high, and high school for children, which puts more people into the fields of science and business.

Also included is free public education for elementary, junior high, and high school for children, which puts more people into the fields of science and business.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Corporatism or corporativism refers to a political or economic system in which power is given to civic assemblies that represent economic, industrial, agrarian, social, cultural, and professional groups. These civic assemblies are known as corporations (not necessarily the business model known as a 'corporation', though such businesses are not excluded from the definition either). Corporations are unelected bodies with an internal hierarchy; their purpose is to exert control over the social and economic life of their respective areas. Thus, for example, a steel corporation would be a cartel composed of all the business leaders in the steel industry, coming together to discuss a common policy on prices and wages. When the political and economic power of a country rests in the hands of such groups, then a corporatist system is in place.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Martial law is the system of rules that takes effect when the military takes control of the normal administration of justice. Usually martial law reduces some of the personal rights ordinarily held by the citizen, limits the length of the trial processes, and prescribes more severe penalties than ordinary law. In many states martial law prescribes the death penalty for certain crimes, even if ordinary law does not contain that crime or punishment in its system. Martial law is sometimes imposed during wars or occupations in the absence of any other civil government.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Barter is a type of trade in which goods or services are directly exchanged for other goods and/or services, without the use of money. It can be bilateral or multilateral, and usually exists parallel to monetary systems in most developed countries, though to a very limited extent. Barter usually replaces money as the method of exchange in times of monetary crisis, when the currency is unstable and devalued by hyperinflation. [PARAGRAPH:2]In the past, goods were to be exchanged in the goods of another without considering of its money value. To organize production and to distribute goods and services among their populations, many pre-capitalist or pre-market economies relied on tradition, top-down command, or community democracy instead of market exchange organised using barter. Relations of reciprocity and/or redistribution substituted for market exchange. Trade and barter were primarily reserved for trade between communities or countries. It is also used when the monetary system failed to measure the economic value of goods.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A contract is a "promise" or an "agreement" made of a set of promises. Breach of this contract is recognized by the law and legal remedies can be provided. In civil law, contracts are considered to be part of the general law of obligations. The law generally sees performance of a contract as a duty.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Majority rule is a characteristic of political systems in which the majority of a population plays a role in decision-making. Majority rule is a major principle of democracy, though many democratic systems do not adhere to this strictly.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Universal Antidote is a highly developed healthcare system in which cure for all diseases have been found. With the help of regenerative medicine, the people stay always healthy and can live for centuries without aging.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A virtual school or cyberschool refers to an institution that is not "brick and mortar bound ". All student services are conducted through Internet technology. The virtual school differ/contrasts from the traditional school through the physical media that links administrators, teachers and students and is an alliance of public distance learning schools.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Instant learning means that people can download content, skills, languages, history or whatever they desire directly into their brains with a click of switch. There's no slow learning process involved, all downloaded information is ready for use right away.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Tribal Law is a system where Tribal leaders or Elders make decisions on all legal matters. There is no written laws, just customs which each tribe member has learned from elders.

TEXT.English: Human sacrifice is the act of killing a human being for the purposes of making an offering to a deity or other, normally supernatural, power. It was practiced in ancient cultures. The practice has varied between different cultures, with some like the Aztecs being notorious for their ritual killings, while others have looked down on the practice as primitive. Victims were ritually killed in a manner that was supposed to please or appease gods or spirits. Victims ranged from prisoners to infants to Vestal Virgins, who suffered such fates as burning, beheading and being buried alive.

Victims ranged from prisoners to infants to Vestal Virgins, who suffered such fates as burning, beheading and being buried alive.

The practice has varied between different cultures, with some like the Aztecs being notorious for their ritual killings, while others have looked down on the practice as primitive. Victims were ritually killed in a manner that was supposed to please or appease gods or spirits. Victims ranged from prisoners to infants to Vestal Virgins, who suffered such fates as burning, beheading and being buried alive.
TEXT.Spanish: Human sacrifice is the act of killing a human being for the purposes of making an offering to a deity or other, normally supernatural, power. It was practiced in ancient cultures. The practice has varied between different cultures, with some like the Aztecs being notorious for their ritual killings, while others have looked down on the practice as primitive. Victims were ritually killed in a manner that was supposed to please or appease gods or spirits. Victims ranged from prisoners to infants to Vestal Virgins, who suffered such fates as burning, beheading and being buried alive.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Secularism or secularity are also used in the meaning of Lacit, a concept related to the separation of state and religion. Secularity is the state of being free from religious or spiritual qualities. For instance, eating a meal, playing a game, or bathing are examples of secular activities, because there is nothing inherently religious about them. Saying a prayer or visiting a place of worship are examples of non-secular activities. An approximate synonym for secular is worldly; although this is often used from a Christian point of view. Secularism has two distinct meanings.[NEWLINE][TAB]1. It asserts the freedom of religion, and freedom from religion, within a state that is neutral on matters of belief, and gives no state privileges or subsidies to religions.[NEWLINE][TAB]2. It refers to a belief that human activities and decisions should be based on evidence and fact, and not superstitious beliefs, however devoutly held, and that policy should be free from religious domination. For example, a society deciding whether to promote condom use might consider the issues of disease prevention, family planning, and women's rights. A secularist would argue that such issues are relevant to public policy-making, whereas Biblical interpretation or church doctrine should not be considered and are irrelevant.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le sécularisme ou le secularity sont également employés dans la signification de Lacit, un concept lié à la séparation de l'état et de la religion. Le secularity est l'état d'être exempt des qualités religieuses ou spirituelles. Par exemple, manger un repas, le jeu d'un jeu, ou se baigner sont des exemples des activités séculaires, parce qu'il n'y a rien en soi religieux au sujet d'elles. Dire une prière ou visiter un endroit de culte sont des exemples des activités non-séculaires. Un synonyme approximatif pour séculaire est mondain ; bien que ceci soit souvent employé d'un point de vue chrétien. Le sécularisme a deux meanings.[NEWLINE][TAB]1 distincts. Il affirme la liberté religieuse, et l'absence de la religion, dans un déclarer qui est neutre sur la croyance, et ne donne aucun privilège ou subvention d'état à religions.[NEWLINE][TAB]2. Il se rapporte à une croyance que des activités et les décisions humaines devraient être basées sur l'évidence et le fait, et à la croyance non superstitieuse, toutefois devoutly tenu, et que la politique devrait être exempte de la domination religieuse. Par exemple, une société décidant si favoriser l'utilisation de condom pourrait considérer les questions de l'empêchement de la maladie, de la planification de famille, et des droits des femmes. Un matérialiste arguerait du fait que de telles questions sont appropriées à définissant la politique public, tandis que la doctrine biblique d'interprétation ou d'église ne devrait pas être considérée et est non pertinente.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Secularism oder Secularity werden auch in der Bedeutung von Lacit, ein Konzept verwendet, das auf der Trennung des Zustandes und der Religion bezogen wird. Secularity ist der Zustand des Seins frei von den frommen oder geistigen Qualitäten. Zum Beispiel eine Mahlzeit sind zu essen, das Spielen eines Spiels oder das Baden Beispiele der weltlichen Tätigkeiten, weil es nichts gibt, das über sie in sich selbst fromm ist. Ein Gebet zu sagen oder das Besichtigen eines Ortes der Anbetung sind Beispiele der nicht-weltlichen Tätigkeiten. Ein ungefähres Synonym für weltliches ist worldly; obgleich dieses häufig von einem christlichen Gesichtspunkt verwendet wird. Secularism hat zwei eindeutige meanings.[NEWLINE][TAB]1. Es erklärt die Freiheit der Religion und Freiheit von der Religion, innerhalb eines Zustandes, der bezüglich des Glaubens Null ist, und gibt keine Zustandprivilegien oder -beihilfe zu religions.[NEWLINE][TAB]2. Es bezieht sich einen Glauben, daß menschliche Tätigkeiten und Entscheidungen auf Beweis und Tatsache basieren sollten, und auf nicht abergläubischen Glauben, gleichwohl devoutly gehalten und daß Politik von der frommen Herrschaft frei sein sollte. Z.B. eine Gesellschaft, die ob man Kondomgebrauch entscheidet, konnte die Ausgaben der Krankheitverhinderung, der Familie Planung und der Rechte der Frauen betrachten fördert. Ein secularist würde argumentieren, daß solche Ausgaben zu allgemeinem politisch maßgebendem relevant sind, während biblische Deutung oder Kirchelehre nicht betrachtet werden sollte und irrelevant ist.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Secularism o il secularity inoltre è usato nel significato di Lacit, un concetto relativo alla separazione di dichiara e religione. Il secularity è il dichiarare di essere esente dalle qualità religiose o spiritose. Per esempio, mangiare un pasto, giocare un gioco, o bagnarsi sono esempi delle attività secolari, perché ci è niente di inerentemente religioso circa loro. Dire una preghiera o visitare un posto di culto è esempi delle attività non-secolari. Un sinonimo approssimativo per secolare è worldly; anche se questo è usato spesso da un punto di vista cristiano. Secularism ha due meanings.[NEWLINE][TAB]1 distinti. Asserice la libertà della religione e la libertà dalla religione, all'interno di un dichiarare che è neutro su credenza e dà il nessun dichiara i privilegi o le sovvenzioni a religions.[NEWLINE][TAB]2. Si riferisce ad una credenza che le attività e le decisioni umane dovrebbero essere basate su prova e sul fatto ed alla credenza non superstitious, comunque devoutly tenuto e che la politica dovrebbe essere esente dalla dominazione religiosa. Per esempio, una società che decide se promuovere l'uso del condom potrebbe considerare le emissioni della prevenzione di malattia, della pianificazione di famiglia e dei diritti delle donne. Un secularist sosterrebbe che tali edizioni sono relative a messa a punto di programmi pubblica, mentre la dottrina biblica della chiesa o di interpretazione non dovrebbe essere considerata ed è irrilevante.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Secularism o el laicismo también se utiliza en el significado de Lacit, un concepto relacionado con la separación del estado y de la religión. El laicismo es el estado de estar libre de calidades religiosas o espirituales. Por ejemplo, comer una comida, jugar un juego, o el bañarse son ejemplos de actividades seculares, porque no hay nada intrínsecamente religioso sobre ellas. Decir un rezo o visitar un lugar de la adoración es ejemplos de actividades no-seculares. Un sinónimo aproximado para secular es worldly; aunque esto se utiliza a menudo desde un punto de vista cristiano. Secularism tiene dos meanings.[NEWLINE][TAB]1 distintos. Afirma libertad, y la libertad de la religión, dentro de un estado que sea neutral en materias de la creencia, y no da ningunos privilegios o subsidio del estado a religions.[NEWLINE][TAB]2. Refiere a una creencia que las actividades y las decisiones humanas se deben basar en evidencia y hecho, y a creencia no supersticiosa, no obstante devoutly está sostenido, y que la política debe estar libre de la dominación religiosa. Por ejemplo, una sociedad que decidía si promover uso del condón pudo considerar las aplicaciones la prevención de la enfermedad, la planificación familiar, y las derechas de las mujeres. Un secularist discutiría que tales ediciones sean relevantes a policy-making público, mientras que la doctrina bíblica de la interpretación o de la iglesia no se debe considerar y es inaplicable.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Industrial Revolution was the major technological, socioeconomic and cultural change in the late 18th and early 19th century that began in Britain and spread throughout the world. During that time, an economy based on manual labour was replaced by one dominated by industry and the manufacture of machinery. It began with the mechanisation of the textile industries and the development of iron-making techniques, and trade expansion was enabled by the introduction of canals, improved roads and then railways. The introduction of steam power (fuelled primarily by coal) and powered machinery (mainly in textile manufacturing) underpinned the dramatic increases in production capacity. The development of all-metal machine tools in the first two decades of the 19th century facilitated the manufacture of more production machines for manufacturing in other industries. The period of time covered by the Industrial Revolution varies with different historians. Eric Hobsbawm held that it 'broke out' in the 1780s and wasn't fully felt until the 1830s or 1840s[2], while T.S. Ashton held that it occurred roughly between 1760 and 1830 (in effect the reigns of George III, The Regency, and George IV).
TEXT.French: [TAB]La révolution industrielle était le changement technologique, socio-économique et culturel principal vers la fin de 18ème et tôt le 19ème siècle qui ont commencé en Grande-Bretagne et la diffusion dans le monde entier. Pendant ce temps, une économie basée sur le travail manuel a été remplacée par on dominé par industrie et la fabrication des machines. Elle a commencé par la mécanisation des industries textiles et le développement des techniques de fabrication de fer, et l'expansion du commerce a été permise par l'introduction des canaux, des routes améliorées et puis des chemins de fer. L'introduction de la puissance de vapeur (remplie de combustible principalement par le charbon) et des machines actionnées (principalement à la fabrication de textile) a soutenu les augmentations dramatiques de la capacité de production. Le développement des machines-outils entièrement métalliques dans les deux premières décennies du 19ème siècle a facilité la fabrication de plus de machines de production pour fabriquer en d'autres industries. La période couverte par la révolution industrielle change avec différents historiens. Eric Hobsbawm a soutenu qu'il 'a éclaté 'dans le 1780s et n'était pas s'est entièrement senti jusqu'au 1830s ou au 1840s[2 ], alors que T.S. Ashton soutenait qu'il s'est produit rudement entre 1760 et 1830 (en effet les règnes de George III, de Regency, et de George IV).
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die industrielle Revolution war die technologische, sozioökonomische und kulturelle hauptsächlichänderung in der späten 18. und früh das 19. Jahrhundert, die in Großbritannien und in der Verbreitung weltweit anfingen. Während dieser Zeit wurde eine Wirtschaft, die auf Handarbeit basierte, durch eine ersetzt, die durch Industrie und die Herstellung der Maschinerie beherrscht wurde. Sie fing mit der Mechanisierung der Textilindustrien und der Entwicklung der Eisenproduktiontechniken an, und Handel Expansion wurde durch die Einleitung der Kanäle, der verbesserten Straßen und dann der Gleise ermöglicht. Die Einleitung der Dampfenergie (getankt hauptsächlich durch Kohle) und der angetriebenen Maschinerie (hauptsächlich in der Textilherstellung) untermauerte die drastischen Zunahmen der Produktion Kapazität. Die Entwicklung der Ganzmetallwerkzeugmaschinen in den ersten zwei Dekaden des 19. Jahrhunderts erleichterte die Herstellung mehr Produktion Maschinen für die Produktion in anderen Industrien. Der Zeitabschnitt abgedeckt durch die industrielle Revolution schwankt mit unterschiedlichen Historikern. Eric Hobsbawm hielt, daß es im 1780s ' ausbrach ' und nicht glaubte völlig bis das 1830s oder das 1840s[2 ] war, während T.S. Ashton hielt, daß es ungefähr zwischen 1760 und 1830 auftrat (in Wirklichkeit die Herrschaften von George III, der Regency und George IV).
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]La rivoluzione industriale era il cambiamento tecnologico, socioeconomico e culturale principale verso la fine del diciottesimo e presto il diciannovesimo secolo che hanno cominciato in Gran-Bretagna e la diffusione nel mondo intero. Durante quel tempo, un'economia basata sul lavoro manuale è stata sostituita da uno dominato da industria e dalla fabbricazione di macchinario. Ha cominciato con la meccanizzazione delle industrie tessili e lo sviluppo delle tecniche di fabbricazione del ferro e l'espansione di commercio è stata permessa tramite l'introduzione dei canali, delle strade migliorate ed allora delle ferrovie. L'introduzione di forza vapore (rifornita soprattutto da carbone) e di macchinario autoalimentato (pricipalmente nel manufacturing della tessile) ha sostenuto gli aumenti drammatici nella capienza di produzione. Lo sviluppo delle macchine utensili tutte di metallo nelle prime due decadi del diciannovesimo secolo ha facilitato la fabbricazione di più macchine di produzione per la produzione in altre industrie. Il periodo di tempo coperto dalla rivoluzione industriale varia con differenti storici. Eric Hobsbawm ha sostenuto che 'ha scoppiato 'nel 1780s e non era completamente ha ritenuto fino al 1830s o al 1840s[2 ], mentre T.S. Ashton ha sostenuto che si è presentato approssimativamente fra 1760 e 1830 (in effetti i regni di George III, il regency e George IV).
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La revolución industrial era el cambio tecnológico, socioeconómico y cultural principal en el último décimo octavo y temprano el diecinueveavo siglo que comenzaron en Gran Bretaña y la extensión a través del mundo. Durante ese tiempo, una economía basada en trabajo manual fue substituida por uno dominado por la industria y la fabricación de la maquinaria. Comenzó con la mecanización de las industrias de textil y el desarrollo de las técnicas de la producción de hierro, y la extensión del comercio fue permitida por la introducción de canales, de caminos mejorados y entonces de ferrocarriles. La introducción de la energía de vapor (aprovisionada de combustible sobre todo por el carbón) y de la maquinaria accionada (principalmente en la fabricación del textil) sostuvo los aumentos dramáticos en capacidad de la producción. El desarrollo de las herramientas de máquina todas de metal en las primeras dos décadas del diecinueveavo siglo facilitó la fabricación de más máquinas de la producción para fabricar en otras industrias. El período del tiempo cubierto por la revolución industrial varía con diversos historiadores. Eric Hobsbawm sostuvo que ' explotó ' en el 1780s y no era se sentía completamente hasta el 1830s o el 1840s[2 ], mientras que T.S. Ashton sostuvo que ocurrió áspero entre 1760 y 1830 (en efecto los reinados de George III, la regencia, y George IV).

TEXT.English: [TAB]Idolatry is usually defined as worship of any cult image, idea, or object, as opposed to the worship of a monothestic God. It is considered a major sin in the Abrahamic religions whereas in religions where such activity is not considered as sin, the term "idolatry" itself is absent. Which images, ideas, and objects, constitute idolatry, and which constitute reasonable worship, is a matter of contention with some religious authorities and groups using the term to describe certain other religions apart from their own.

Which images, ideas, and objects, constitute idolatry, and which constitute reasonable worship, is a matter of contention with some religious authorities and groups using the term to describe certain other religions apart from their own.
